alert.note: Alert for Somervell; Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 3:50AM CDT until May 15 at 6:08PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Johnson, Montague, Parker, Somervell, Tarrant and Wise. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Worth, Burleson, Cleburne, Weatherford, Benbrook, White Settlement, Crowley, Azle, Keene, Decatur, Bridgeport, Joshua, Bowie, Lake Worth, Briar, Eagle Mountain, Pecan Plantation, Pecan Acres, Willow Park and Reno.
